acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 6,171mg/kg (RTECS (2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 (as cobalt and inorganic compounds) by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B (cobalt and cobalt compounds) by IARC (1991) and Category 1 (as cobalt and cobalt compounds) by the Japan Society for Occupational Health.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: May cause long lasting harmful effects to aquatic life
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although L(E) C50 <=100 mg/L data existed, since it was metal and the behavior in the water was unknown, it classified into Category 4.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible, because of the unidentified configuration and the absence of data. The powder or granules, when mixed with the air, may cause dust explosion (ICSC (2004)). Metal powder including but not limited to cobalt (Non-flammables, and excluding those with specific product names) is classified into Category 4.1, Packing Group II and III (UN#3089), by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods.

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Inorganic substance containing no oxygen and halogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible, because of the unidentified configuration and the absence of data. The powder is pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures (ICSC, 2004)

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in IARC 52 (1991) and ATSDR (2004): histological changes of testes and reduction in survival rates of offspring are observed, though no descriptions are available regarding the general conditions of parental animals.

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the classification by the Japan Society for Occupational Health and the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy (Respiratory Tract Sensitizing Substance).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the classification by the Japan Society for Occupational Health and the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy (Skin Sensitizing Substance).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "respiratory irritation, stridor, asthma, pneumonia, fibrosis, myocardiosis, functional effects on the cardiac vehicles, cardiac hypertrophy, cardiac failure due to occupational exposure to cobalt" (ATSDR (2004)). The effects are observed in the respiratory organs and heart, while those on the heart are considered secondary effects and hence are not taken into account.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "respiratory irritation" (ATSDR (2004)).
